data.title: Journal of Economics Bibliography
data.meta_description: Before entering the East African currency board:  The case of Zanzibar (1908-1935)
data.text:
Bank of Tanzania (2015). History of the Bank of Tanzania. [Retrieved from].

Bartlett, C.A. (1936). Statistics of the Zanzibar Protectorate, 1895-1935. Zanzibar Government Print.

Bissell, W.C. (2011). Urban Design, Chaos, and Colonial Power in Zanzibar. Bloomington, Indiana: Indiana University Press.

Blumenthal, E. (1963). Tanganyika – East Africa: The Present Monetary System and Its Future. Dar es Salaam: Government Printer.

Colonial Report, (1913-1936). Great Britain, Colonial Office. Annual Report on the Social and Economic Progress of the People of Zanzibar Protectorate. London: H. M. Stationery Office. Microfilm. East Ardsley England: Microform Imaging, Ltd.

Crofton, R.H. (1921). Statistics of the Zanzibar Protectorate, 1893-1920. London: The Eastern Press, Limited.

Crofton, R.H. (1928). Statistics of the Zanzibar Protectorate, 1893-1927. Zanzibar Government Printer.

EACB. East African Currency Board (1936). Report of the East African Currency Board for the Period Ending the 30th June, 1936. London: Waterlow and Sons.

East Africa Further Correspondence Part XCIV. Great Britain (1908). Government Papers. National Archives, (U.K.). Archives Direct. Web. [Retrieved from].

Ferguson, E. (1989). Value theory and colonial capitalism: The case of Zanzibar, 1897-1945. African Economic History, (18), 25-56.

Government Gazette. See Zanzibar, Zanzibar Government Gazette.

Hanke, S.H. (2002). Currency Boards. Annals of the American Academy of Political and Social Science, 579, 87-106.

Hanke, S.H. (2002). On dollarization and currency boards: Error and deception. Journal of Policy Reform, 5(4), 203-222.

Hanke, S.H. (2008). Friedman: Float or Fix?, Cato Journal, 28(2), 275-285.

Imam, P. (2010). Exchange rate choices of microstates. International Monetary Fund Working Paper, No.WP/10/12. [Retrieved from].

Krus, N., & Schuler, K. (2014). Currency board financial statements. Studies in Applied Economics Working Paper Series, Johns Hopkins Institute for Applied Economics, Global Health, and Study of Business Enterprise. [Retrieved from].

Lomoro, G.M. (1964). East African currency board: Background and current problems. Makerere Institute of Social Research, Economic Development Research Programme Working Paper, No.22. [Retrieved from].

Morris, H.F. (1979). Government Publications Relating to Zanzibar, 1860-1963. East Ardsley, England: EP Microform Ltd. [Retrieved from].

Mwangi, W. (2001). Of coins and conquest: The East African currency board, the rupee crisis, and the problem of colonialism in the East African protectorate. Comparative Studies in Society and History, 43(4), 763-787.

Red Book (1922). The Directory of East Africa, Uganda & Zanzibar. Nairobi and Mombasa: East African Standard Limited. [Retrieved from].

Shelswell-White, G. (1949). A Guide to Zanzibar: A Detailed Account of Zanzibar, Town and Island. Zanzibar: Government of Zanzibar.

Throup, D., Bourne, K., Cameron, W.D., & Partridge, M. (1995). British Documents on Foreign Affairs—Reports and Papers from the Foreign Office Confidential Print. [Bethesda, MD]: University Publications of America.

War and Colonial Department and Colonial Office (Great Britain) (1915) Africa, Confidential Print. Government Papers November 1907 to August 26 1913. National Archives (U.K.) (976-984). Archives Direct. Web. October 4, 2015. [Retrieved from].

Zanzibar (1908-1936). Zanzibar Government Gazette. Zanzibar Government Printer.

Zanzibar (1921-1936). Zanzibar Government Blue Book. Zanzibar: Government Printer.

Zanzibar (1917-1920). Zanzibar Government Blue Book. Microfilm. East Ardsley, England: Microform Imaging, Ltd.

Zanzibar (1919-1936). Zanzibar British Colonial Reports. London: H. M. Stationery Office.
